matcher.options: /Current Billable Usage Cost|Billable Usage Cost|Fraction of total credit used this month|Fraction of total credit used/

targets.legendFormat: Fraction of total credit used this month
Credit remaining as fraction of total credit @ month-start

targets.expr: ((avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_sm_overage{org_id="$org_id"}) + avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_sm_browser_overage{org_id="$org_id"})) OR avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_sm_overage{org_id="$org_id"}))- (9999999999 * $is_customer_of_partner) >= 0 > 0

((avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_sm_bill_fraction{org_id="$org_id"}) + avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_sm_browser_bill_fraction{org_id="$org_id"})) OR avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_sm_bill_fraction{org_id="$org_id"}))- (2 * $is_customer_of_grafana) >= 0 > 0

panels.title: Current Billable Usage Cost by Product

options.content: ## About Billable Usage The **billable usage cost** panels display the currently accrued monthly costs for usage of your billable services. - Metrics ingestion cost is calculated and billed using the 95th percentile of your active series and their samples, called data points, per minute (DPM). - Logs and traces costs are calculated and billed according to total monthly ingestion in bytes. - Grafana users cost is calculated and billed according to the number of active monthly users, with additional per user costs for IRM (and Enterprise plugin for Pro tiers) - Load testing (k6) is billed according to Virtual User hours (VUh) - Synthetic Monitoring is billed according to total monthly test executions. Reconcile Invoices with this Dashboard
View Invoices
Billing FAQ

matcher.options: /Current Billable Usage Cost|Billable Usage Cost|Fraction of total credit used this month|Fraction of total credit used/

targets.legendFormat: Credit remaining as fraction of total credit @ month-start

targets.expr:
(
    (
        sum(avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_total_overage{org_id="$org_id"}))
        - (9999999999 * $is_customer_of_partner) >= 0
    )
    and day_of_month() == 1 and hour() == 0
)

(
    (
        sum(avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_bill_credit_fraction{org_id="$org_id"}))
        - (2 * $is_customer_of_grafana) >= 0
    )
    and day_of_month() == 1 and hour() == 0
)

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to metrics

links.title: Go to Active Series and DPM Billing FAQ

targets.expr: max(grafanacloud_instance_billable_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_metrics_billable_series{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_metrics_overage{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) topk by(id) (1, grafanacloud_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"})- (9999999999 * $is_customer_of_partner) >= 0

max(grafanacloud_instance_billable_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_metrics_billable_series{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_metrics_bill_fraction{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) topk by(id) (1, grafanacloud_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"})- (2 * $is_customer_of_grafana) >= 0

options.content: ## About Billable Metrics Series This panel displays the 95th percentile of your active series and samples, or data points, per minute (DPM) for this month so far. You can dig deeper into your daily ingestion rates, totals, and more in the **Metrics Ingestion Details** row directly below this panel. For more information on cardinality and metrics usage, you can: - Learn to Control Your Metrics Usage - Locate your highest cardinality metrics from your Cardinality Dashboards - Get started with our new Adaptive Metrics cost optimization tool.

panels.description:
Shows:

- Total active-series per managed Prometheus metrics service (GrafanaCloud Stack).
- Active-series ingested in the Datadog format
- Active-series ingested in the Influx format
- Active-series per installed integration (with default job-name in Agent config)
- Active-series generated by Asserts

targets.expr: max(grafanacloud_instance_active_integration_series{id=~"$metrics_id"}) by (id, integration) * on (id) group_left(name) topk by(id) (1, grafanacloud_instance_info{id=~"$metrics_id"})

panels.title: Metrics Active Series

options.content: ## About Metrics Active Series An active series is a time series that receives new data points or samples. If you stop writing new datapoints to a time series, shortly afterwards it is no longer considered active. Learn more about Active Series. Your Metrics Active Series panel graphs the total number of active series ingested to Grafana Cloud per push (scrape_interval) at a certain point in time. We recommend setting that scrape_interval to a resolution of once per minute (60s) to keep ingestion costs down. If you are sending series more frequently than once per minute, you will see this reflected in the rate of Data Points per Minute (DPM) in the two panel rows below.

panels.description:
Shows up to 3 of your stacks, ordered by those with the greatest average DPM per active-series.

This value calculated at the current instant. ie. `now()`
panels.title: Highest Metrics DPM Stacks (top 3 stacks)

options.content: ## About High DPM Your Highest Metrics DPM Stacks panel displays your top (or only) metrics ingestion instances and their current DPM (Data Points per Minute). Your plan has an included DPM rate, displayed numerically in green on the gauge panel. If you are sending metrics series at a rate per minute above that number (displayed center), you will see it metered in red. See the graph panel below for the active series ingestion per minute, over time. To learn more about how this affects your billing, see: Active Series and DPM. To control or change your DPM, check out: Changing your metrics scrape interval.

panels.title: Metrics Active Series Ingestion Rate per Minute (DPM)

panels.description: To learn more about these errors and their potential causes, refer to [Monitor Prometheus for ingest errors](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/data-configuration/metrics/metrics-prometheus/errors-monitoring/).

targets.expr: sum(max(grafanacloud_instance_samples_discarded_per_second{id=~"$metrics_id"}) by (id, reason)) by (id, reason) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_instance_info{id=~"$metrics_id"})

panels.title: Discarded Metric Samples

panels.description:
The panel displays active series broken down by user-defined usage groups, and the number of active series not assigned to any group. This can be used for internal back-charging. Read the [documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/cost-management-and-billing/analyze-costs/metrics-costs/define-usage-groups/) to learn more about this feature.

Please contact support to get this set up.

defaults.noValue: No data. Contact Grafana Labs Support to set up usage groups.

targets.expr: max(grafanacloud_instance_active_usage_group_series{id=~"$metrics_id"}) by (id, group) * on (id) group_left(name) topk by(id) (1, grafanacloud_instance_info{id=~"$metrics_id"})

panels.title: Active series per usage group

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to Graphite Metrics
Current fraction of cost due to Logs

links.title: Go to Log Volume Explorer FAQ

targets.expr: max(grafanacloud_logs_instance_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_logs_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_logs_overage{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_logs_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"})- (9999999999 * $is_customer_of_partner) >= 0

max(grafanacloud_logs_instance_query_overage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_logs_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_logs_overage{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_logs_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"})- (9999999999 * $is_customer_of_partner) >= 0

max(grafanacloud_logs_instance_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_logs_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_logs_bill_fraction{org_id="$org_id"})* on (id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_logs_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"})- (2 * $is_customer_of_grafana) >= 0

options.content: ## About Billable Logs Your **total billable logs usage** is calculated using the total number of ingested bytes generated by your logs for the entire month. You may generate additional billable logs for log retention periods above 30 days, or logs query usage above 100x of ingested logs volume. You can dig deeper into your daily ingestion rates, totals, and more in the **Logs Ingestion Details** row directly below this panel. For more information on logs usage, see: - Understanding your Grafana Cloud Logs Invoice - Analyze and Understand your Logs usage

targets.expr: sum(sum_over_time((grafanacloud_logs_instance_bytes_received_per_second{id=~"$logs_id"} offset -1d * 60)[1d:1m])) by (id) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_logs_instance_info{id=~"$logs_id"}) or vector(0)

sum(sum_over_time((grafanacloud_logs_instance_query_bytes:rate5m{id=~"$logs_id"} offset -1d * 60)[1d:1m])) by (id) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_logs_instance_info{id=~"$logs_id"}) or vector(0)

panels.description: To learn more about these errors and dig into potential causes check out our Loki article on [Troubleshoot Cloud Logs write issues](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/send-data/logs/troubleshoot/)

targets.expr: sum(grafanacloud_logs_instance_samples_discarded_per_second{id=~"$logs_id"}) by (id, reason) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_logs_instance_info{id=~"$logs_id"})

panels.title: Discarded Log Samples

panels.description: Shows the ratio of queried to ingested bytes over the selected time period on each of your stacks.
panels.title: Query Usage Ratio

options.content: "Query Usage Ratio" shows the ratio of queried to ingested bytes on each of your stacks. If this ratio exceeds the "Query Fair Usage Ratio" configured for your plan, you will incur additional charges. Learn more: Fair use policy for GBs queried

panels.description: The query fair usage ratio configured for your current plan
panels.title: Query Fair Use Ratio

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to Logs Retention Usage

targets.expr: max(grafanacloud_logs_instance_retention_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_logs_retention_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_logs_retention_overage{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_logs_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"})- (9999999999 * $is_customer_of_partner) >= 0

max(grafanacloud_logs_instance_retention_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_logs_retention_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_logs_retention_bill_fraction{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_logs_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"})- (2 * $is_customer_of_grafana) >= 0

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to Traces

targets.expr: max(grafanacloud_traces_instance_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_traces_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_traces_overage{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_traces_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"})- (9999999999 * $is_customer_of_partner) >= 0

max(grafanacloud_traces_instance_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_traces_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_traces_bill_fraction{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_traces_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"})- (2 * $is_customer_of_grafana) >= 0

options.content: ## About Billable Traces Your **total billable traces usage** is calculated using the total number of ingested bytes generated by your traces this month. You can dig deeper into your daily ingestion rates, totals, and more by expanding the **Traces Ingestion Details** row directly below this panel. For a guide on traces usage management: Reduce Grafana Cloud Traces cost.

targets.expr: sum(sum_over_time((grafanacloud_traces_instance_bytes_received_per_second{id=~"$traces_id"} offset -1d * 60)[1d:1m])) by (id) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_traces_instance_info{id=~"$traces_id"}) or vector(0)

panels.description: To learn more about why spans were discarded, refer to the [Discarded Spans](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/cost-management-and-billing/understand-your-invoice/usage-limits/#discarded-spans-panel-in-the-billing-dashboard) metric definitions.

targets.expr: sum(grafanacloud_traces_instance_discarded_spans_total:rate5m{id=~"$traces_id"}) by (id, reason) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_traces_instance_info{id=~"$traces_id"})

sum(grafanacloud_traces_instance_adaptivetraces_discarded_spans_total:rate5m{id=~"$traces_id"}) by (id, reason) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_traces_instance_info{id=~"$traces_id"})

panels.title: Discarded Spans

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to Grafana Users

links.title: Go to Billing for Active Users FAQ

options.content: ## About Billable Users Your **total billable grafana users** is determined by all monthly active Grafana users and their associated costs. Active users are only billed once per month across all your stacks. You can dig deeper in the **Grafana Users Usage Details** row directly below this panel. For additional per user costs generated from an Enterprise plugin add-on, expand the **Enterprise Plugin Add-On** row.

targets.expr: sum(sum(grafanacloud_grafana_instance_active_user_count{id=~"$grafana_id"}) by (id) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_grafana_instance_info{id=~"$grafana_id"})) by (name)

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to Additional Enterprise Plugin

options.content: ## About Enterprise Plugins Under the Pro monthly subscription plan it is possible to add a single (1) Grafana Enterprise Plugin for use across your account. Once added, this comes at an additional cost of $25 per Grafana active user. If you've added an Enterprise plugin, your Billable Enterprise Plugin Users panels displays your total number of Grafana active users and the additional aggregated cost at $25/user, this month so far.

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to IRM Users Usage

options.content: ## About IRM Users Your Total Billable IRM Users panel reflects all active users of IRM services this month. A user is considered active if they are included in OnCall schedules or escalation chains, or if they perform any of the actions below: - Changed status of alert group or OnCall configuration - Got paged or paged someone - Created, declared, edited, updated, or deleted an Incident

targets.expr: sum(sum(grafanacloud_irm_active_user_count{id=~"$grafana_id"}) by (id) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1, grafanacloud_grafana_instance_info{id=~"$grafana_id"})) by (name)

panels.title: Active Grafana IRM Users per stack (last 30 days)

options.content: ## About Active IRM Users per Stack This panel displays the total number of active users of IRM services per stack over the last 30 days. Note that an active IRM user in two or more stacks is counted only once for billing purposes.

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to Kubernetes Monitoring Hosts

panels.title: Total Billable Kubernetes Monitoring Host Hours

options.content: ## About Kubernetes Monitoring Host Hours Your Kubernetes Monitoring Host Usage is calculated from the total number of host hours this month. * Understand your Grafana Cloud Kubernetes Monitoring invoice

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to Kubernetes Monitoring Container

panels.title: Total Billable Kubernetes Monitoring Container Hours

options.content: ## About Kubernetes Monitoring Container Hours Usage Your Kubernetes Monitoring Container Usage is calculated from the total number of container hours this month. * Understand your Grafana Cloud Kubernetes Monitoring invoice

panels.title: Total Ingested Kubernetes Monitoring Host Hours by day
Total Ingested Kubernetes Monitoring Container Hours by day

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to VUh Usage

options.content: ## About k6 Virtual User Hours Your Total k6 Billable Usage is based on Virtual User hours (VUh) used during your load tests. You can dig deeper into the kind of k6 usage generating billable VUh in the k6 Virtual User Hours (VUh) Details row directly below this panel. * About k6 Virtual User Hours * Understand your k6 invoice

panels.description: This panel displays VUh broken down to stacks, type protocol and browser.
panels.title: k6 Virtual User Hours (VUh) usage by stacks and type

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to k6 Static IPs Usage
Current Billable k6 Static IPs Usage

options.content: ## About k6 Static IPs Your Total number of provisioned k6 Static IPs. * Understand your k6 invoice

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to Profiles Usage

targets.expr: max(grafanacloud_profiles_instance_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_profiles_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_profiles_overage{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) topk by(id)(1, (grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{org_id="$org_id",name!~"(.*)-traces$"} or label_replace(grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{org_id="$org_id",name=~"(.*)-traces$"},"name","$1-profiles","name","(.*)-traces$")))- (9999999999 * $is_customer_of_partner) >= 0

max(grafanacloud_profiles_instance_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_profiles_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_profiles_bill_fraction{org_id="$org_id"})  * on (id) group_left(name) topk by(id)(1, (grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{org_id="$org_id",name!~"(.*)-traces$"} or label_replace(grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{org_id="$org_id",name=~"(.*)-traces$"},"name","$1-profiles","name","(.*)-traces$")))- (2 * $is_customer_of_grafana) >= 0

options.content: ## About Billable Profiles Your Total Billable Profiles Usage is calculated on the total number of ingested bytes generated by your profiles this month. Usage of Grafana Cloud Profiles is subject to Grafana Cloud Pricing for Profiles. * About Grafana Cloud Continuous Profiling * Blog: Unify your Observability signals with Grafana Cloud Profiles You can dig deeper into your daily ingestion rates, totals, and more in the **Profiles Ingestion Details** row directly below this panel.

targets.expr: sum(grafanacloud_profiles_instance_bytes_received_per_second{id=~"$profiles_id"}) by (id) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by(id)(1, (grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{id=~"$profiles_id",name!~"(.*)-traces$"} or label_replace(grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{id=~"$profiles_id",name=~"(.*)-traces$"},"name","$1-profiles","name","(.*)-traces$")))

sum(sum_over_time((grafanacloud_profiles_instance_bytes_received_per_second{id=~"$profiles_id"}  offset -1d * 60)[1d:1m])) by (id) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by(id)(1, (grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{id=~"$profiles_id",name!~"(.*)-traces$"} or label_replace(grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{id=~"$profiles_id",name=~"(.*)-traces$"},"name","$1-profiles","name","(.*)-traces$"))) or vector(0)

sum(grafanacloud_profiles_instance_discarded_bytes_per_second{id=~"$profiles_id"}) by (id, reason) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by(id)(1, (grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{id=~"$profiles_id",name!~"(.*)-traces$"} or label_replace(grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{id=~"$profiles_id",name=~"(.*)-traces$"},"name","$1-profiles","name","(.*)-traces$")))

sum(grafanacloud_profiles_instance_usage_group_estimated_billable_bytes_received_per_second{id=~"$profiles_id"}) by (id, usage_group) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by(id)(1, (grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{id=~"$profiles_id",name!~"(.*)-traces$"} or label_replace(grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{id=~"$profiles_id",name=~"(.*)-traces$"},"name","$1-profiles","name","(.*)-traces$")))

panels.title: Profiles Estimated Ingestion Rate by usage group

options.content:
## About Usage Groups

Usage groups provide a mechanism to break down billable usage by
different attributes (for example, by application). The values provided
by this panel are not exact down to the byte, nor are billable bytes
calculated from this data, rather these values are best-effort
estimates.

Usage groups are not self serve. To configure your usage groups,
please contact Grafana Labs Support.

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to Frontend Observability

options.content:
## About Frontend Observability

Your Frontend Observability Usage is calculated from the total number of ingested sessions this month.

You can dig deeper into your daily ingestion rates, totals, and more in the **Frontend Observability Details** tab in the **Usage Drilldown** section at the bottom of this view.

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to Application Observability

panels.title: Total Billable Application Observability Host Hours

options.content:
## About Application Observability

Your Application Observability Usage is calculated from the total number of host hours this month.

targets.expr: sum by(stack_id) (max_over_time(grafanacloud_instance_active_traces_host_info_series{org_id="$org_id"}[1d]))  * on(stack_id) group_left(slug) topk by(stack_id)(1, grafanacloud_grafana_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"})

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to Synthetics

panels.title: Total Billable Synthetics Protocol Test Executions

options.content: ## About Synthetics Protocol Usage Synthetics Protocol Usage is calculated from the total number of protocol-based test executions this month from HTTP, DNS, MultiHTTP, Ping, TCP, Traceroute, and k6 scripted check types. Refer to the billing calculations for more information on how test excutions are counted. You can dig deeper into your test execution rates and totals in the Synthetic Monitoring Usage Details row below.

targets.legendFormat: Current fraction of cost due to Synthetics

panels.title: Total Billable Synthetics Browser Test Executions

options.content: ## About Synthetics Browser Usage Your Synthetics Browser Usage is calculated from the total number of k6 browser test executions this month. Refer to the billing calculations for more information on how test excutions are counted. You can dig deeper into your test execution rates and totals in the Synthetic Monitoring Usage Details row below.

panels.description: Shows the 1 hour average rate of tests executed per second by check class
panels.title: Synthetics Test Execution Rate (executions/second)
Synthetics Test Executions per day by check class

targets.expr:
sum(
  sum_over_time(
    (grafanacloud_sm_billable_check_executions_per_second{org_id="$org_id"} offset -1d * 60 )[1d:1m])
  ) by (id) * on(id) group_left(name) topk by (id) (1,grafanacloud_grafana_instance_info{id=~"$grafana_id"})

panels.title: Synthetics Test Executions per day by stack

options.content: Looking for the drilldown of your Usage Details? We moved these further up. You can find them directly below their corresponding Product Usage panels. They are collapsed by default and available to expand, just as before.
